entries.title: Former Afghan Lawmaker Shot Dead at Her Home in Kabul
entries.description: The legislator, Mursal Nabizada, was one of a few female parliamentarians who remained in the country after the Western-backed government collapsed and the Taliban seized power.

entries.title: European Parliament Focuses on 2 More Lawmakers in Corruption Scandal
entries.description: The assembly on Monday began the process of lifting the immunity of two members at the request of the Belgian police in a snowballing corruption investigation involving Qatar.

entries.title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Chinese ‘Zero Covid’ Workers Revolt
UK Confirms Plan to Send Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: The U.K. defense secretary said specialty guns, ammunition, drones and other equipment were also part of the package being sent to Ukraine.

entries.title: Sunak Blocks Scottish Legislation Making Gender Change Easier
entries.description: For the first time, the British government in London is blocking legislation approved by the Scottish Parliament, saying the measure on gender identity would undermine U.K.-wide equality law.

entries.title: U.N. Confirms More Than 7,000 Civilian Deaths in Ukraine
entries.description: The total includes only those that U.N. investigators have been able to corroborate, and does not include the dozens killed in Saturday’s strike on Dnipro.

entries.title: Hamas Releases Video That Appears to Show Israeli Missing Since 2014
entries.description: If verified as authentic, the footage would provide the first public proof of life of Avera Mengistu, an Israeli citizen who disappeared after walking into Gaza and had been held captive by Hamas.

entries.title: Armed Insurgents Kidnap 50 Women in Burkina Faso
entries.description: The women were abducted while searching for food in a region that has been under a blockade by extremist groups for nearly a year.

entries.title: Britain leads a push for more Western military aid to Ukraine, and soon.
In Nepal Crash, Pilot Met the Same Fate as Her Husband 17 Years Before
entries.description: Anju Khatiwada, who died on Sunday in a crash in Pokhara, Nepal, decided to become a pilot after her husband’s death in 2006. The family’s calamities are part of a deadly pattern of aviation disasters in Nepal.

entries.title: London Police Officer Admits to 49 Charges of Sexual Abuse, Including Rape
entries.description: David Carrick, who worked for the Metropolitan Police, carried out “a relentless campaign” of violence over 17 years, prosecutors said, using his position of authority to manipulate victims.

entries.title: Christine Lambrecht Resigns as Germany’s Defense Minister
entries.description: Christine Lambrecht was a frequent target of criticism, including over German caution on military aid to Ukraine. Chancellor Olaf Scholz had backed her strongly, and may find her hard to replace.

entries.title: A united Europe weathers crises, but deeper challenges remain.
Russia is pulling off the biggest art heist since the Nazis in World War II, experts say.
Ukraine’s Pursuit of Weapons Pays Off as U.K. Promises Tanks Soon
entries.description: Britain also plans to lobby the U.S., Canada and Europe to send their own tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: Putin’s Wins and Losses
entries.description: Ukraine’s winter slowed the war, but there have been major developments.

entries.title: Matteo Messina Denaro, Italian, Mafia Boss, Is Arrested
entries.description: Matteo Messina Denaro, who was sentenced in absentia for the 1992 murder of two prosecutors and other crimes, was apprehended in a Sicilian hospital.

entries.title: The war in Ukraine upended energy markets. What does that mean for the climate?
entries.description: Almost a year after Russia launched its invasion, assessing the impact on the oil industry and greenhouse gas goals is not so simple.

entries.title: Covid Workers in China Clash With Police Over Unpaid Wages, Layoffs
entries.description: Companies that reaped windfalls helping the government implement strict ‘zero Covid’ controls are now struggling to pay and keep workers.

entries.title: What 70 Years of War Can Tell Us About the Russia-Ukraine Conflict
entries.description: Despite some postmodern features, the fighting resembles a type of conflict from decades past: wars fought between nations in which one does not conquer the other outright.

entries.title: What 70 Years of War Can Tell Us About the Russia-Ukraine Conflict
entries.description: Despite some postmodern features, the fighting resembles a type of conflict from decades past: wars fought between nations in which one does not conquer the other outright.

entries.title: German Defense Minister Resigns After Weeks of Criticism
entries.description: The minister was repeatedly attacked over public blunders and her handling of the war in Ukraine. She is the most senior member of Olaf Scholz’s government to resign.

entries.title: Your Monday Briefing
entries.description: A search for survivors after a Russian strike on a residential building.
